website_summaries.verdict: About half the price of high-end sets with similar quality and functions. Unless you need  extremely bright lights, save some money and pick this set.
pros: A reasonably-priced headlight/taillight set with straightforward design and installation
Provides LED light with 4 settings including fast/slow flashing modes
cons: A few reports of strap breakage and failure to charge
Not quite as bright as bike lights with lumen ratings, but still produces bright, wide-angle illumination

customer_reviews.title: The best and I've tried most...
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered my third set of these [have a few bikes and I will not ride without lights]. The absolute best; and I've tried a few. All more expensive by the way. They're rechargeable,fit most head tubes as well as handlebars and they give you extra straps. They are remarkably bright [can be seen from the side too] with three bulb pattern and the charge lasts quite a while. Lastly, they look cool ~ round chrome like shape. Don't even think about others...
customer_reviews.author: PJ jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Super Fun !!!
customer_reviews.text: simple to use =) worked fine =) very bright for size =) not focused well =( the white light is so blue it almost appears purple =) When charging there is a red status indicator built in and when charge is finished a green light status is shown =) works off a phone charger =) extra rubbers and USB cables included =)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, fits on a skateboard
customer_reviews.text: Love these. I bought them for my electric skateboard and they fit to the trucks really well. I’m very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after few uses
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after a handful of uses. The USB charging connection just got pushed in. Light doesn't work anymore. Reached out to seller no response. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Warranty's a sham
customer_reviews.text: After using them for about 17 months, the FRONT light suddenly stopped working, no warning, no reviving it through charging. Of course, ALWAYS.. I have enough extra back lights lying around now. Since it's still within the warranty time frame I tried contacting 'them' here thru the reviews/q& a here: ascher_shop@hotmail.com to no avail. ** Between the 2 I've tried, this one is better though, bigger, brighter & lasted longer(even if maybe a fluke, ha). The other brand, also with sham warranty: "Magnus Innovation Bold 360 Bike Light Kit, Super Bright USB Combo Light Set " I'm sticking with my local bike shop for lights w/a legit warranty, from now on.
customer_reviews.author: rescue dog mama

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after using 3 times
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as backups to my expensive lights 1 year and 1 month ago. I have used them 3 times in the past year and keep them charged. The front headlight still works great. I keep these indoors in a box so they are not exposed to the weather. Yesterday while getting ready for a long bike trip, I checked my lights and the rear light will not turn on. It is charged, just does not work. I didnt except these to last forever but this is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McCarley

customer_reviews.title: Safe your money
customer_reviews.text: The worst product purchase ever. One light is already broken.... see the photo and the worst part is that Amazon doesn’t want to pick it up “because it’s low value item but instead they want me to drop it a USPS office which is like 2hrs process including my walk.... they want to use my 2hrs for third faulty product of 18$ (including tax) for free to refund my money? No way will pick it up and o will make this issue public on all media that I have access to
customer_reviews.author: A buyer

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: Middle bike has the light on it for this review. Not bright at all. It does not light up the road enough in a dark path to see where your going. You can be seen but you can’t see. The mounting system is pretty sloppy. It’s one strap that is a stretch and hook kinda thing. Don’t like it.
customer_reviews.author: DanN

customer_reviews.title: "Super Bright" is a bit of an exaggeration.
customer_reviews.text: I found this item disappointing. The headlight is bright enough for automobile drivers to see you at night but not bright enough to be of much use for seeing obstacles in your path in time to avoid them. Of course, it's completely useless in the daylight. The tail light is adequately bright at night but because the mounting system allows for no adjustment of the angle of the light, it mostly lights up your rear tire if your seat tube is inclined much off the vertical. You could no doubt improvise a solution to this but because entire assembly must be removed every time you recharge the light, you'd have to redo it every time. I’m looking for another light.
customer_reviews.author: Carl A. Maniscalco

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof, will stop working in mild rain conditions.
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this again. I live in a rainy state, and ride often in the rain and dark, so it is important to have lights. These lights were not nearly as waterproof as promised and stopped working in less than 2 months. Customer service is extremely lacking, and after some back and forth emails, they are supplying a coupon for a replacement. On the positive, the mounting system is fantastic. I just wish they still worked.
customer_reviews.author: JohnandAshley

customer_reviews.title: Best used to be seen not to see with
customer_reviews.text: So I'm a bit torn on these. For the price of them and the fact they are rechargeable I would suggest these to anyone who lives in an area with plenty of street lights. I on the other hand live out in the country without a streetlight anywhere near me. Now I still use these but only as flashers, they work amazing and the battery life is great when used only for flashing. But when I try to use it as an actual light I can't see enough to actually ride safely. So I'll have to look for something brighter for being able to see but for cars seeing me these are great.
customer_reviews.author: brian woolf

customer_reviews.title: Lights are very dim
customer_reviews.text: The lights are very dim on this product. I could bare see five feet in front of me on a road without street lights. I don’t feel safe riding my bike using these lights at all. In fact, I rode on bumps and rock with these lights on because I couldn’t see them. These lights don’t serve the purpose intended. Get a better product instead of you want to keep yourself safe.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Nah, not so much. Not sure why this is amazon’s Choice
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one for my self and another brand for my wife I first went out with mine and thought it was pretty cool. When I got home my wife was ready to go for a ride. when I saw her Ascher Ultra I was like embarrassed that I went out on the rode with this regular Acher . The Front is not bright enough to even illuminate the stop signs. The back is better it seems bright enough and I like the functions. If I don’t return this it will be because I like the back light. Maybe I can use this one to point down and illuminate the reflectors or something.
customer_reviews.author: wayne Narcisse

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying these
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these are great and I would definitely buy them again. They make our bikes more visible from a distance both day and night. Rechargeable is great. Dont expect these to put out as much light as a car headlight. but do expect these make you more noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Headlight won't hold a charge. First ride pieces fell off.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: The belt broken and the warranty is a lie
customer_reviews.text: They seem to work well until one day I was riding my bike and someone called me and handed me the backlight. The belt was broken and the light fall of from my bike. Now it`s useless because I can not tie it back on my bike. The warranty is totally a lie: I contact the company based on their return policy, no one response at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kiora W

customer_reviews.title: Very Bright, long lasting battery!
customer_reviews.text: This are bright lights which make it easy for vehicle to see you on the road during the day or night and not just as a means to light up the road when it's dark. The lights last a long time between charging and can be charged with the USB cord which is included. I put them on the charger over night and they are ready to go by morning. Very easy to install on the front and rear of the bicycle as the rubber strap can stretch and has different mounting holes as well. Very good light overall.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Everything is good, it's rechargeable
customer_reviews.text: The main reason that I marked 4 stars for these lights is that reart light doesn't have accurate angle. You can't see the light directly straight because seat poste has a little angle. Everything is good, it's rechargeable, bright, not too big.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: A Piece of Crap
customer_reviews.text: My wife woke me up in the middle of the night and said the bicycle light was flashing. I went into the kitchen where the bike was and sure enough, the front light was blinking. I hit the power button on the light, but it just kept on coming on. I won't be able to send the light back for a refund as I unstrapped the light, and right then and there it took flying lessons right to the tile floor. It won't blink again. It was only two days old. Another piece of Chinese junk!
customer_reviews.author: Rik Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Try them, you’ll like them.
customer_reviews.text: You don’t have to rave about them, but they are a good add-on for your bike and your safety. I like them for their ease of use and the fact that if I forget to turn them off, well I can just charge them back up. I have followed my wife while riding at different positions and distances, and I have no problem in the day or night seeing her position. With that said, they fit my objective, more risk reduction and mitigation while riding. My overall opinion remains to be delivered. I want to see the longevity of these devices, and their overall durability. For me they are priced right for a Prime product and I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Red Bastien

customer_reviews.title: Decent cheap light, with 4 light settings.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these lights for a couple months now and haven't needed to charge them since their initial charge. I like that they have 4 settings (bright, semi-bright, slow flash, and fast flash) that work for various riding scenarios. They are cheaply built though, so I don't expect them to last more than a year. I had the shiny edge cover unscrew and come off the rear light while riding and it's now lost. I'm not sure why it wasn't glued in place, since as far as I can tell it is decorative and not functional. I suspect these lights will slowly start to fall apart with time.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonTink

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely No. Wanted a simple light set for my son to use infrequently. While this was bright enough, it is a piece of cheap junk. The mounting system is weak and I predict lights would fall off easily (loose rubber band with a small nub to wrap around). The metal colored parts are light and flimsy and one fell off when installing (it just needed to be screwed back on but felt like a Happy Meal toy). This is a poor investment with built in obsolescence. You won't pay much but you won't get much and soon it will be heading to the landfill. This is a good example of the worst side of our consumerist culture.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya McLean

customer_reviews.title: Nice, simple lighting system
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my kid for when he rides after dark. They are very bright. I love the feature that allows them to flash if you want them to. They are easy to charge and so far, we have not used them enough to run the battery out. The charge lasts at least a couple of hours. Very easy to attach. There are thick rubberized bands that simply loop around the handlebar or the seat bar....wherever you want the thing. They hold securely and don't come off unless you take them off. Overall, very good value for a nice, functional light set.
customer_reviews.author: Dstar

customer_reviews.title: It works and the battery lasts
customer_reviews.text: Great if you're desperate for a bike light. If you absolutely need the cheapest option, this works and has a long battery life (been using them for 3 months without any issue). The back light does a sufficient job. The front light really isn't all that strong and if you can afford a better light, like a cycle torch, you should explore that option. However, this light works as a great back-up.
customer_reviews.author: suki

customer_reviews.title: Good price, headlight not bright enough.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - lights are very small and discreet - mounting is super easy and mostly secure - charging is fast - nice to have multiple lighting modes Cons: - major con: headlight is not bright enough to function as a night time headlight, even on its brightest setting - not sure how long the rubber mounting bands are going to last - mode button is hard to see in the dark, and not super easy to operate (it blends in with the rest of the light's case)
customer_reviews.author: The Big Burrito

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Safety
customer_reviews.text: These lights are bright and were easy to attach to my mountain bike. I feel like some of the reviews I read on this product were negative. For this price point, they're of good quality. A friend was trying to get me to purchase a $70 set but that wasn't in my budget. These are good for visibility. Also, I think I read a review where someone was trying to use these for navigational purposes. They are not headlights, they are simply steady lights or flashers so vehicles and other bikes and pedestrians see you! Just FYI. Happy customer here.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C.

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - easy to attach/detatch - rechargeable (haven't had to recharge yet though) Cons: - unattractive - light isn't super bright - beam is unfocused and provides pretty limited illumination of the road Overall, I preferred my previous bike light which got stolen (it's no longer sold on Amazon sadly) - back light doesn't have a higher frequency flashing setting
customer_reviews.author: T H

customer_reviews.title: Simple, great quality, bright, and low price
customer_reviews.text: Looking at so many different models of really expensive bike lights, this product had a great price and good quality. My city requires bike lights and these worked perfectly for front and back. The charge lasted a really long time and they are rechargeable, so no installing batteries. The lights are bright, easy to see, and easily attached to handlebars and seat post. They are easy to put on and take off, so they don't get stolen. Super simple, efficient, and useful.
customer_reviews.author: Gardenguy

customer_reviews.title: Good for what you pay for it.
customer_reviews.text: These lights snap on to your bike with ease. The tail light is bright enough. I'd give it a 5 star for brightness. The headlight, not so much. More of a 2 or 3 star for brightness. But for $13 you can't expect too much more. Overall, I'm pleased. I needed the tail light more than the head light anyway. And I love that you can just recharge them and not need to change batteries all the time. I might by another set for another bike.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: Makes You Visible, Not Great for Lighting Your Way
customer_reviews.text: These are great little quick add ons that make you pretty visible on the road when it's dark or overcast. I love that they charge via USB. The headlight is not quite powerful enough for lighting your path. It's adequate for smooth roadways or paths that you are familiar with, but I wouldn't use it for rough terrain or any place you're not already fairly familiar with. Mounting, it goes on fast with these silicon feeling bungee type connectors and they don't rattle when riding in rough areas. I have taken these everywhere from smooth bike paths to highways to intermediate level MTB single track trails and they have been stable, silent, and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Packaged incorrectly.
customer_reviews.text: It was delivered mismatched. The front headlight charging port is not the same as the rear flasher. (Oversized) and will not accept any charging cable. Let alone the supplied one. I guess the consolation is I now have extra cables and mounting brackets for the rear flasher. Buy at your local bike shop. How can you screw up something so simple. Rear flasher works well so far. Update now rear won't take a charge now. All ready installed its replacements. They take the watch batterys. Good enough. These pair were a fail.
customer_reviews.author: Terry smith

customer_reviews.title: Great small lights with excellent visibility
customer_reviews.text: Let me say first that I dont buy lights to help me see, but to be seen. These have four settings, steady low, steady high, slow flash and fast flash. These are easily seen from a long distance, very small so as not to be in the way and easy to attach and remove for charging. Also - rechargeable is way smarter than having to buy batteries, less expensive and more efficient. Can use a micro usb cable to charge anywhere so I am unlikely to ever be caught with a dead light again.
customer_reviews.author: Chili70

customer_reviews.title: Nice light set
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these lights. They are a good size that fit bike nicely. Very bright. A good feature is that you can see when they are charging and when fully charged. Very easy to install. Comes with two sets of straps. These lights will help others see you rather that give you a lot of light to see in front of you, although it does provide some light in very dark areas. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Todd H.

customer_reviews.title: Read my review, I highly recommend these!!
customer_reviews.text: These have several flash modes, or steady on. I bought these to put on my dogs collar because he's a big axx dummy and likes to run out to the street to read the news. Soooo, these have a couple different methods of mounting to things. Are they bright? Heck yes, very bright. That's what we like right with the lights is bright? Yes, these are. Also nice is that they are USB rechargeable. Doesn't get any simpler than that. I don't know how long the charge last, I haven't had them go dead yet. But leds do go a long time. I highly recommend these as they can have many applications
customer_reviews.author: Private Eye

customer_reviews.title: So far, I'm pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these lights as added protection while riding during the day and at dusk. I want motorists to be aware of my presence. Haven't had a chance yet to try them while riding. I turned them on in my home, in the dark and they seemed fairly adequate. Charging them via USB seems easy, though mine came fully charged. Charging cords are a bit short, but should work okay. I use a converter and plug them into an outlet. (My computer isn't on unless I'm actually using it.) Attaching them to my bike was very simple and fast. Straps are adjustable which is good as I needed a tighter fit on my rear bag attachment. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Tootles

customer_reviews.title: poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the lights yet, as I just received them yesterday, but aside from longevity after charging, I have a pretty good idea of the quality of the product. First, the charging-the cable does NOT fit well in the lights. The plastic covering the little recharge outlet covers it so the charger does not fit in the hole. Second, the rubber attachments that are supposed to hold the light in place under the bike's seat and on the front handlebars are way, way too small/short. They do not go all the way around as shown in the pictures. So far, not impressed with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Farmer chick

customer_reviews.title: Clip used to mount the lights is poorly attached, breaks off easily.
customer_reviews.text: Did not have an opportunity to use these lights. The clip on the red light became unattached immediately when I tried to attach the rubber lasso onto it. The clips are attached to the lights using a screw in plastic, which is sure to break under any reasonable amount of strain. I was lucky in that I noticed this early on before I used the lights. The clip could have broken later while I was riding, after the window during which I could return the poorly designed product. I would recommend against purchasing these bike lights or any other similar bike lights. If you need rechargeable lights, you can always use rechargeable batteries with many different types of bike lights.
customer_reviews.author: Nemo

customer_reviews.title: My favorite, works great and fantastic price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty amazing for such a cheap light! I have gotten several lights for my bike and this one is my favorite - and it was the cheapest! (I lost the white front one so am only talking about the back red one). I have to take it off when I get to my office bc things get stolen quickly where I am and this is really easy to take off and on. I haven’t been riding my bike much because of covid but I rode it the other day and the light worked without charging in at least a month. And it worked the next day too. I like settings choices and use the blinking the most for the road.
customer_reviews.author: jpb mom

customer_reviews.title: Performance at a bargain price
customer_reviews.text: At under $17 on Amazon for a pair of these lights, these they are perfect "see me" lights for daytime cycling. High visibility output, long battery life, easy installation, light weight. I've owned much more expensive lights; but when 2 of them suffered battery failures after less than 1 year of use, I purchased these with low expectations. I was really surprised at how well they performed. If the batteries fail to charge after awhile -- so did my $80 per unit models - I'll be happy to replace them both less than $70. They do the job well, at a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews but this product has so exceeded my expectations that I will make an exception. The design is elegant due to its simplicity. It mounts securely and without any tools. The build quality is surprising in something this inexpensive. The packaging was excellent and very high quality. I fully charged them both when they arrived to test their duration. The information included claimed they would run approximately 9 or 10 hours in the fast flash mode. So far, they have been running 17 hrs with no sign of weakening. I am very impressed and will be buying more of these for family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: salley

customer_reviews.title: Work Great
customer_reviews.text: I use these to commute home from work, a 30 minute ride. Sadly my last bike was stolen with these in tow. I like them so much I bought a second set to replace the set that was stolen. Quick easy install, so easy and non-intrusive that you can pop em on and off in seconds, and they are pretty universal so if you have a second bike, you can move these from bike to bike with ease. They are bright enough to not only illuminate the street before you, but also to be noticed by cars so they can avoid you. All in all a quality product, I would buy and have bought again
customer_reviews.author: Good Morning America

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered and received these lights for my bike, and they are working well. The elastic band makes it so easy to mount on the bike, and I was delightfully surprised to see that two extra bands are included. The units are USB charged which should make it much easier/cheaper than having to buy batteries that are impossible to install. One can see some of the light on both front and back from the SIDE of the unit making one more visible in the dark. I will update this review if I find issues with these lights after I've had them for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect level of brightness, features and price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for safety, riding around town. Bought a set for each of my kids. 5 options are easily selected by making simple, consecutive clicks of the power button. Flashing options are wonderful for catching a driver’s attention. I needed something inexpensive, reliable, bright, with a few flash modes but simple enough for a young child to operate. Holds a charge for a very long time. I generally throw them on a charger every 2 weeks and haven’t had one die yet. So reasonably priced I actually have bought a few for friends in town. Well worth the peace of mind and keeping our kids safe.
customer_reviews.author: rtmunro

customer_reviews.title: Bright - I feel safer now
customer_reviews.text: These are so bright, no one has an excuse for not seeing me now when I'm biking. I use them in the flashing mode during the daytime and they are easily visible from a good distance away. I love the fact that they are rechargeable, although I haven't used them enough yet to see how long I get from one charge. The bands for mounting seem to stretch well enough to allow for placement several places on the bike. I'm slightly concerned as to how well the rubber will hold up when taking them off and on the bike. But, since they include extra bands with the lights, I should be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bright Rechargeable Front/Rear Bike Lights ..
customer_reviews.text: Compact, Bright, Multi Blinking/Non Blinking Configurations, Rechargeable, Bike Lights Work Very Well while Staying Put on Bike Without Shifting Around from Hitting Bumps.. I Don't Always have to Remove them Either for Fear of being Stolen because they are so Compact and Dont Stand Out like Others do !! Lights Illuminate From the Sides also which Is a Plus-BUT ONLY WHEN MOUNTED ON A HORIZONTAL BAR AND NOT WHEN MOUNTED ON A VERTICAL BAR ?? Would Like to See This "Re-Designed" For Either Position For "Safety Sake" !!
customer_reviews.author: glittle

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done with no fuss
customer_reviews.text: Needed some safety lights for my new ebike and these ones are working great. The tail light is bright enough to see on sunny days and has multiple blinking options. The front light is useful but not strong enough for using as a full headlight...you'll probably want an actual spotlight for night riding. Consider these safety lights and you will be happy. Other likes: -Easy to mount with no tools needed -Rechargable batteries so I can plug directly to my bikes USB port -batteries seem long lasting, I haven't had them run out yet
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Check periodically to make sure the lights are charged.
customer_reviews.text: I have these on my bike because I ride in the bike lane on busy streets. I like that they have several settings--one that flashes to ensure you have the attention of drivers on the road. Because I live in Arizona, it may be that the heat shortens the life of the battery charge. Other than that, I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will make you visible but doesn't illuminate much
customer_reviews.text: I like the mounting system, but if you have a bmx style bike with the pad and the number plate, you may need to get a little creative to mount the headlight. The headlight doesn't illuminate very much but you'll be visible for sure. The buttons and charging port look and feel pretty well water-proofed. I have it on my son's bike - he's 9 and can turn them on and off with just a little difficulty. We've only been out twice for a total of about 30 minutes, so I'm not sure how long the batteries last - they're still strong after 1/2 hour or so.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Just as bright and rechargeable USB is a plus.
customer_reviews.text: Great product and as stated they are easy to install and great for evening rides. I purchased these and another set by a different brand and honestly the difference is so minor that I had to double check which lights were brighter and even then I wouldn’t be any less impressed with these lights. One note, I did have just a small issue with one of the lights USB port and getting the cord connected to the light. After 2 tries it was charging. These lights are awesome and priced reasonably especially for being rechargeable.
customer_reviews.author: KKT

customer_reviews.title: excellent bike light system for that price
customer_reviews.text: I have used multiple bike light systems and find this to be the best so far. The rear light is much brighter than any other I have used. The mounting system allows very easy removal for charging. Both front and rear have belt type clips that can be used for things other than the bike such as runs, dog walks or hiking. I don't think you will find this quality for this price in any other bike light system. The only minimal downside I find is that the front light is not quite as bright as some.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth E. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great lights but sometimes they pop off when using the clip
customer_reviews.text: I have a few of these but was disappointed tonight when a rear one popped off my daughter's bike bag and got run over by a car. Haven't had this problem before. Bummer to lose one on the first ride. Not asking for it to be replaced because I can't really blame the design. Dropped rating to 2 when the one on my son's bike disappeared. I may reorder, but they'll be installed with Zip ties next time. Very disappointing since the similar pair with another brand name stamped on them has not had an issue on my bike in months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super bright!
customer_reviews.text: These lights are super bright which is what you want when you cycle at night all the time, like me. I love that I can charge them through a USB port - no more batteries to buy. I have switched seat posts since buying these but they easily accommodate just about any size tubing. They secure well and I have not experienced any slipping around or bouncing around - they stay put. They are easy to take on/off so if you take your bike to the store like I do, they easily come off and fit into a pocket for safe-keeping while you shop. I wouldn't leave them on my bike, can be easily stolen.
customer_reviews.author: jodiealoha

customer_reviews.title: Front light quit working after 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I received these several weeks ago and was initially happy with them. I ride usually 3 or 4 days a week. I ran both front and back on the slow blink and the initial charge lasted about 2 1/2 weeks. I recharged both front and back and on my 2nd ride after recharging the front light quit working and will not take a charge. All the rides were in good weather. I'm not sure how to get my money back or get the light replaced. I would not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great product, pleased with overall purchasee
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price and product. Only issues I had and did not find in instruction manual were two things; 1. How long it takes to fully charge lights first time. 2. Unsure why other buyers mentioned "SOS" MODE, no mention of that in manual Would definitely buy again if needed. Don't understand why so many questions posted for things addressed in manual, or questions like will it fit on girls bike, or on backpacks, etc... Did make for some interesting reading though.
customer_reviews.author: bdmcdona

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a good value.
customer_reviews.text: Received these lights (front and rear) today and am charging them prior to installing them. The installation seems straight forward and the rubber bands make mounting them very easy. My only concern is the lithium battery and how long to charge it as the booklet says not to charge too long although it says '3 hours'. It also says there are indicator lights to signal when the battery is fully charged. I would not charge these lights an excessive amount of time, i.e. overnight for fear of the battery overheating.
customer_reviews.author: DGROBBY

customer_reviews.title: See and be seen
customer_reviews.text: I charge both of the lights as soon as I got them. I love the different lighting modes. The front head light reached at least a half a block for me. The headlight was able to reflect off the stop signs in front of me. I was even doing some yard work at night, and I decided to utilize the headlight to see what I was working on in the dark. I just clipped it onto my shirt or my pants and got to work. I’m sure if I wore a hat or a headband, it would have been even better. I’ve only used my light for 4 hrs at the most, but it shined bright until I was done.
customer_reviews.author: WAM33

customer_reviews.title: A good buy.
customer_reviews.text: These lights are very bright. I’m a commercial lighting supply project manager, and I specialize in selling commercial lighting fixtures and other led lights for biking always seemed to low of a lumen output. But these are very bright. They have multiple settings which is great. The mounting system is nice but not sure how it’ll hold up entirely. I will try to write back after some use. They seem sturdy and ready for action. The packaging came with extra mourning clips and two usb chargers so you can charge both lights at the same time. Really nice packaging and customer care. I think these will do great.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Bernhardt

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Set of Lights
customer_reviews.text: Took a long, multi-day bike ride with friends and found that my rear light battery lasted for only 2 or 3 hours. My friend's light was lasting the full 6-7 hours and going strong. He was using this set of lights and gave me the information. I purchased the set and they are on my bike. Very compact, easy to charge and install. They last a LONG time without being charged. Both have multiple blinking options and are very bright. The price is unbelievable for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: F. Deltorchio

customer_reviews.title: SMALL BUT BRIGHT
customer_reviews.text: I ride every morning between 4 am and 4:30 am so I got these little lights so people leaving our park for work could see me. and don't let there size scare you they are very bright! there also very easy to mount (which was great for me as I am 63 yrs old and I have arthritis in my hands.) you have 4 different choices as to setting your light speeds. and the life of the batteries has been more than a week. comes with 2 USB cables and extra mounting straps. For me this has been a GREAT investment and I would purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Great light, but broke within weeks - other 3 are still going, and they are great.
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 white ones, and 2 red ones. We were very happy with them - bright, rechargeable, different modes - worked great until they didn't. One broke within weeks, but after I could send it back. I'm pretty disappointed, but considering the cost and their effectiveness, I'll get another one hoping it was a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: burntoutonsubstandardproducts

customer_reviews.title: Bright. Fast, easy on/off mount.  Small enough for your pocket when you park.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, even came in a nearly presentation quality box. Hated to recycle it. Pros: 1. fast mount/dismount front & rear. Just tuck the small units into your pocket when you park to keep from having them stolen. 2. Bright. The asymmetrical flash (pop, pop—long darker—pop, pop) is the kind of pattern I notice when I drive during the day. I suspect this is true of most people. My bike has steady burning lights built in, fore & aft. But I still mount the Aschers for a random flash pattern at night. 3. Long charge life on batteries. Cons: none that I can think of.
customer_reviews.author: rhkennerly

customer_reviews.title: Bright enough to be seen at night, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: These lights work well if you just want to be seen; the headlight does not provide enough light to see much of the ground. The time between charges is pretty good, and they are easy to install on the bike. The one thing I don't like is I find it a little difficult to plug the cable in to get them charged.
customer_reviews.author: EEF

customer_reviews.title: these are great! They're bright
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I expected less. But woah, these are great! They're bright!! And you can recharge them!! I don't ride in pitch blackness, so can't tell you how they'd work in that circumstance for actual visibility. But at dusk, dawn, and during the day, they certainly let the cars know we're there. And that's my main goal.
customer_reviews.author: Nan in NV

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PLUG INTO MACBOOK PRO TO CHARGE
customer_reviews.text: Great lights, insanely bright and great build quality compared to other bike lights in this price range! PLEASE BEWARE charge this with an adapter to a wall mount. I’ve plugged it into my MacBook Pro once and my computer was fried for a week - I think it was some sort of short circuit problem. Immediately died and wouldn’t start back up. Avoid charging this on anything but a wall charger or portable charger! I would not plug it into any valuable electronics to charge. Great lights!
customer_reviews.author: Dominic hong

customer_reviews.title: Small but bright.  Easy to mount with tools and stays secure.
customer_reviews.text: These work as advertised. There are 4 modes, full on and flashing with different brightness. They are bright....much brighter than the old fashion incandescent bulb types. They charge up quickly with a mini USB cable like nonApple electronics use. The mount is basically a rubber band with different tightness options. I thought that it might be hard to keep this secure and aimed where you want. But, it was very quick and easy to install and aim and it stays where you set it.
customer_reviews.author: kireviewer

customer_reviews.title: Not Well Built
customer_reviews.text: I’ve taken these lights on five city rides and during my ride to work, part of the wall hardware popped off. The light is still intact, but this is not a good sign for how these are built. Like I said, only five rides in with them. Unless you plan on only using these lights less then fives times, I suggest trying a different brand. And after contacting Amazon support, apparently this company doesn’t have a phone number, so now I need to email them instead of Amazon support calling them to replace the lights.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Very bright and easy to mount and to use
customer_reviews.text: This is the best of this type of product that I've tried thus far. Very easy to mount without risk of falling off the bike. The four options, bright, brighter, slow blink and fast blink, should fit any occasion. Even in the blinking mode, the light is very bright. I was worried with the rechargeable battery that I'd be constantly having to remove and recharge. Hasn't been a problem as haven't had to recharge once after over 6 hours of use. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Durham

customer_reviews.title: Impressed, Easy Right Out Of The Box
customer_reviews.text: I happened to be in a hurry when I got these and expected to take a minute to figure these out, but they were pretty intuitive. Both lights came fully charged, strapped on my bike with ease and I was on my way. I am a little concerned that the rubber bands that attach them to the bike will lose elasticity, but there was no immediate evidence of that. In any case, it comes with a second set of bands. Of course, these are rechargeable, so no batteries to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Lavoris L'Oreal

customer_reviews.title: Amplified Reflectors
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a lead light, but the white light is not useful for riding in the dark, except for use as a front reflector. The other issue is that the rubber bands used to secure the lights to the handlebars and/or the rear don't allow for tilting. The back red light is ok, but it tilts slightly upward instead of ahead. I should have purchased a front headlamp, separately. I also found it awkward turning off the back light while riding, once daylight arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra ONeil

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money, Will Fall Off
customer_reviews.text: My rear light fell off within a few days. I secured it as good as you can. Had I known it was going to fall off I would have used some wire to give additional security. Communicating with them is a waste of time and frustrating. Not sure if they are just not that bright or English isn't their first language.
customer_reviews.author: Craftefy

customer_reviews.title: One week And I'm Already Unable To Recharge Front Headlight!!!
customer_reviews.text: If it wasn't for this fact, I would give my recently purchased Ascher USB Rechargeable Bike Light Set ,Super Bright Front Headlight and Rear LED Bicycle Light, 4 or possibly 5 stars overall. The price was reasonable, but the quality control on the one headlight is lacking for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Truer Reviewer 2019

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product to keep you visible in traffic (not that most drivers pay attention). Easy to charge, easy to mount and so far very secure front and rear. The 2 strobe functions work well and are very noticeable from a good distance. While there are two solid light modes and they have some brightness they most likely won’t replace a good solid headlight. All in all for the price they are so far a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Rosenfeld

customer_reviews.title: Great little bike lights!
customer_reviews.text: These are probably the best value bike lights we've ever purchased! I can't believe what you get for the price. The packaging alone is impressive, and then there are the accessories and the lights. Mounting is super easy and solid with the rubber straps, the two lights (1 front, 1 rear) are well built and very bright with 4 very useful settings, and a micro-usb cable is provided for charging. Easy to follow instructions are also provided. I can't comment on the battery life yet since I just got them. I intend to buy another set or two, that's how confident I am about these.
customer_reviews.author: Marcela

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 sets of these due to its positive reviews. I am very happy with the purchase and due recommend them. They came packaged nicely, extra rubber bands, and 2 usb chargers. I was careful not to overstretch the bands as they have been reported to snap and had no issues. All 3 of mine were well made, felt solid in my hand and the power button also feels solid like it could easily last a few years. The led lights are super bright and stand out for sure at dusk and night.
customer_reviews.author: Arnaldo

customer_reviews.title: Strong Rear headlight!
customer_reviews.text: I mainly wanted this for a rear flasher as I think it helps protect you from getting hit by cars. I haven't used the front white light yet so can't comment on that, but the rear flasher is strong and noticeable (I rode behind my daughter who also has one), and the charge lasts a good long time. I like the mounting system so I can put it on my under seat bike tool kit. I know of so many people getting hit by cars so this really is an important safety issue, even during the day.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Well made and an attention grabber while cycling
customer_reviews.text: This flashing front headlight and taillight certainly will help give me a sense of security while riding my bicycle on the streets, day or night. The lights will attract attention from distracted drivers. I know that is a big problem these days with drivers busy talking or texting while driving. Hopefully these lights will serve the purpose of added safety. Great product, I highly recommend purchasing this product (with rechargeable batteries).
customer_reviews.author: RockDoctor41

customer_reviews.title: Compact & Bright, Long Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: This white light is compact and still very bright although I would not use it as a headlight. It works very well as a signal light. Per the instructions, the light should operate for 10 hours on a charge. My light lasted over 15 hours on a charge using the fast flash. It is not a real problem, but I did try to charge the lights using a USB cable that I already had and the lights would not charge. I then used the USB cables that came with the lights and the lights charged OK.
customer_reviews.author: Art G

customer_reviews.title: Bike lights more than bike lights
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought a set of these lights for my new bike. They are perfect. Then I had this great idea - I could use a set for when I took my dogs out for their nightly walk. I love them for this. I clip the headlight on the front and I can see a clear path for the dogs. I set the red light to flashing and clip it to the back of my dog pack so cars can clearly see the dog brigade. i also like the fact that I can easily recharge the lights.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love them and they worked perfectly for me!
customer_reviews.text: I have to order them again because the previous pair was stolen. But the lights works wonderfully. They are bright enough to keep me safe. It is very easy to charge and install. The package is well-organized and can store the wires and extra mounting straps without creating a mess. The second order comes in a even better box which has a woody texture that I could happily put it on the shelf as a decoration while storing the components. Love these a lot!
customer_reviews.author: blindmouse

customer_reviews.title: bike light upgrades!
customer_reviews.text: Although i wouldnt suggest anyone riding in the dark, these lights are still a necessity. They cane in pair, white light in the front and red for the rear. I've tested them during the day and the light beams are still noticeable. I speacially use the rear light as you can change the lights to pulsate. I havent charged them since it arrived from shipping and ive been using them for 2 days already so im assuming the batt. life is good. I would definitely recommend these lights.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dobo

customer_reviews.title: Dead after one ride in torrential rain
customer_reviews.text: I liked the lights and I wanted to like the lights. They look nice. The mounting system is great. However, I was caught in a torrential and for safety, I turned on my tail light, but not my front light. After that, I am unable to turn off the tail light. It cycles through various blinking patterns but does not turn off. Even after I have let the battery run out it has the same behavior. What good is a bike light that can't withstand rain?
customer_reviews.author: Schlamminger Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Very bright and easy to mount!
customer_reviews.text: Mounted these lights in less than 30 seconds and they have various modes: bright, dim, flashing bright, flashing dim. I have ridden with these once at night on a trail. I was able to see decent enough to get home safely, but I wouldn't rely on these consistently. The front headlight is best used at dusk. If you want something to ride at night you will definitely want something with significantly higher lumens. I still recommend this product though and I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Magnus

customer_reviews.title: Seem to work great!  Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: So far, I've only taken them out of the packaging, briefly installed and tried them, and then took them inside to charge. They installed easily and the documentation was acceptable. I tried out each of the lights in all four modes. I really didn't know that they had four modes when I purchased them but it is kind of neat and they work. Took them inside and charged them (no 120V portion included just USB to mini cords, one for each light). It did take quite a bit of time to charge but I'm assuming that they will last quite a while (unknown at this time).
customer_reviews.author: James L Beam

customer_reviews.title: Delivers what is promises but... Needs to be much brighter.
customer_reviews.text: Well made, but if you plan to light the path in front of you on a bike... no. This falls short of that. Really it is a great pair of lights but they need to be about 5x brighter and about 2x more optically aligned.
customer_reviews.author: Starfleet

customer_reviews.title: Best lighting system hands down
customer_reviews.text: I often run into issues with lights because I have a recumbent trike with the steering from hips. The back has a rack that won't take the clip-on types. With the elastic band, I can mount it anywhere on the bike. It also came with 2 additional straps and was charged upon arrival so it was easy to test. I have a different front light on the left that turns off or on if my knee grazes it. I like this system so much so that I'm going to buy it again as I like having the 2 front lights. I may affix the spare backlight to my flag to further help drivers see me.
customer_reviews.author: Mikahla Mornay

customer_reviews.title: One set for my daughter, one set for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 6-year-old daughter's bike and they really light up nicely at twilight and in the dark, with multiple settings (flat, different time-length blinks). I use the basic blinking red light for the back of her bike, and the constant-on white light for the front. Just one light on the front provides a bright look ahead. And they are rechargeable! I hope they last nicely because I just bought another set for my own bike, an adult men's hybrid road bike, so that I can safely escort my daughter's night-time bike rides this fall and beyond.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great value at this price
customer_reviews.text: These lights install quickly with a stretchy rubber clip, stay secure, and come off easily for recharging. Each set comes with 2 spare rubber clips. Each light has a solid-light mode and 3 flashing light patterns, which change by the push of a button. I generally use them for 3 to 4 rides of about 45 minute duration each week, and they have needed recharging only every 2-3 or weeks, or maybe less-frequent than that. I've never actually run the charges all the way down.
customer_reviews.author: P Glauser

customer_reviews.title: Nice lights
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I'm upgrading my review to 5 stars, because these are still a GREAT value. I bought another set for my mountain bike. I put the lights on flash, and I get about 20 hours of ride time on a single charge. These are really nice lights. Will fit anywhere, easy to charge, and easy to tell when they are charged. Bright, dim, flashing modes. Bought 2 sets for bikes, wife took one set for her mobility scooter so I need another set. Four stars instead of five because they keep increasing the price on me. Mine where $15, now I have to pay $17. Still worth it, but not as good a deal.
customer_reviews.author: TheLizard

customer_reviews.title: Great product - but...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Quick and easy addition to enhance your visibility on the road. My only beef is that the plastic clip on the back of the light is not strong enough or tight enough to rely on just using the clip as the means of fastening the red rear light. I lost my previous light by clipping it onto a loop on my seat-mounted tire-changing kit. The light must have fallen off when I hit a bump in the road. Lesson learned: use the black rubber strap provided to mount the rear light to the seat post.
customer_reviews.author: Mike-fl

customer_reviews.title: Good Set of Lights for Visibility Purposes Only
customer_reviews.text: There are a number of these light sets that all seem to be the same and this is my second purchase of this type of light. My only complaint is the difficulty in getting the USB cord into the light itself. It is a tight fit and you need to hold back the flap covering while trying to get the cord into the light and I would suggest the the manufacturer relocate the USB port on the lights to a more easily accessible spot..
customer_reviews.author: lvolp

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike lighting
customer_reviews.text: These are very bright for rechargeable lights. The mounting is via a rubber strap, I custom mounted the front on the upper fork of the bike. It required a small rubber piece under the light to bring the beam to face forward at the correct angle. Just a minor adjustment as the brake and shifter cables can interfere with the light beam. I used the same trick on the backlight mounted on the seat post, so light beam faced straight back. All in all a great way to light up the road for a night ride.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive. Well made
customer_reviews.text: Tail light is great - headlight not so much. Headlight is useful only to be seen, not to see (people riding at night or in shadow should find a high end lamp that is bright and has a long and wide throw). The rubber mounts are versatile. Charging ports are inconvenient - a challenge to get the cable inserted. The housing is rugged, but doesn’t fit a helmet. Not sure about rain. Inexpensive set that is well made v
customer_reviews.author: D. Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service not the best.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic piece that covers the USB charging plug pulled right off the first time I used it. I contacted Ascher and they credited me $9 because they are sold as a set. The light still works but will no longer be waterproof so if I want to replace the light, I will have to buy the pair of them again. Doesn't make a lot of sense to me, but that is how they handled it. I would have rather had them send me a replacement light . . hard to believe they can't do that, but oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Wings

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!  Bright easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Perfect!!! These have great options for flashing light or constant light. They charge up quickly and mount very easily. Super helpful even during day time bike rides for drivers to see you. So glad I added these to my bike instead of going to the bike shop and spending triple. Great product I can see using these for walking the dog at night. In Michigan bike season is almost over so I plan to put these in my truck as a just in case tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Quality lights
customer_reviews.text: First, the lights came in packaging that was gift-ready, very impressive. But more importantly, the lights are super-bright. I've purchased many blinkies, but these are by far the best. Very visible, easy to switch between modes, and shut off. I also like they can be re-charged with a USB cable, no more batteries. I cannot comment on battery life because I haven't used them long enough. So far, VERY pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One light (rear red) worked fine out of the box
customer_reviews.text: One light (rear red) worked fine out of the box. Front white light did not work and needed overnight charging to light up. It only last for 20 min. So only got a rear light. No good - binned
customer_reviews.author: js5d

customer_reviews.title: Love em, but had to order two sets to get one good working set (double check charging wire for fire hazard)
customer_reviews.text: Two things, works awesome if they work but one original ordered red light keeps going out after being on for just a few minutes and one of the charging wires got really hot while charging the light, so check charging wires to make sure not a fire hazard. But you get what you pay for, inexpensive, had to order two sets to get one good set, but easy to put on your bike, nice bright LED lights. Charge lasts about one-month plus with use 3 times a week or so 15 minutes a time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great rechargeable bike lights, easily clip onto a backpack or strap to a bike, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: The following pair of bike lights worked great. Can be charged via regular USB chords (2 come with the set). There's 4 different light modes and they're bright enough to make you stand out during the day time in Florida. They come with clips to easily latch onto a backpack, or straps to tie down to the back or front of a bike post for example. I would highly recommend them, especially since they make you much more visible to the average distracted driver just in case you can't ride your bike on a dedicated bike path or sidewalk.
customer_reviews.author: ETC

customer_reviews.title: Vetty nice!
customer_reviews.text: These lights are BRIGHT! Which is great, as one would like to be seen while on a bike. The mounting hardware seems pretty easy, just wrap the rubber strap around a bar on your bike (handle bar, seat post, etc.). I have yet to ride my bike at night, but with these lights, everybody will see when I do!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Day

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Will buy a 2nd Set!
customer_reviews.text: These little guys are a great buy. I like them because the rear light clips to my saddle bag (as opposed to my seat post - it will also clip to a seat post). It has 4 light modes - I prefer the double strobe so that I can clearly stand out to traffic. The charging port is a little tough to get to because of the way the rubber covers close over them...but it’s still an effective design. They have an green light indicator to alert when charging is complete.
customer_reviews.author: hawkman0220

product_meta.title: Ascher USB Rechargeable Bike Light Set,Super Bright Front Headlight and Rear LED Bicycle Light,650mah Lithium Battery,4 Light Mode Options(2 USB cables and 4 Strap Included)
feature_bullets: ADVANCED DESIGN: USB rechargeable light, built in 650mAh rechargeable lithium battery for each light.

FOUR LIGHT MODE OPTIONS: The Headlight and Taillight feature an one-touch switch with four different lighting modes depending on your preference. Include full brightness, half brightness, fast flashing and slow flashing.

EASY INSTALLATION: The silicone mount straps are designed with two openings that tightly fit around many size seat posts, handlebars, seat risers, backpacks, helmets and stretch to keep lights secure and firm. They can be easily loosen and fasten, and no tools are required.

MUTIFUNCTION: This bike light set is versatile enough for cycling, hiking, camping, or any outdoor activity and can be used as emergency flashlight. This is great for cycling at night or in places where visibility and safety are concern. So, just start your next adventure with us.

BUY WITH CONFIDENCE: Ascher is committed to providing our customers with high quality products, we are dedicated to ensuring your fully satisfaction. Please contact us when you have any problem, we will solve the problem for you as soon as possible.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
